verses.kjv: Then fourteen years after I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and took Titus with me also.
verses.web: Then after a period of fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus also with me.
verses.ct: 14 years later, I went up to Jerusalem again, this time with Barnabas, and I brought Titus along too.

verses.kjv: And I went up by revelation, and communicated unto them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately to them which were of reputation, lest by any means I should run, or had run, in vain.
verses.web: I went up by revelation, and I laid before them the Good News which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately before those who were respected, for fear that I might be running, or had run, in vain.
verses.ct: I went because God revealed to me that I should. While there, I laid out the gospel message I'd been preaching to the Gentiles. But I did this privately with the recognized leaders, because I wanted to make sure the work I was doing — and had already done — wasn't for nothing.

verses.kjv: But neither Titus, who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised:
verses.web: But not even Titus, who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised.
verses.ct: And here's the key thing: not even Titus, who was with me and is a Greek, was forced to be circumcised.

verses.kjv: And that because of false brethren unawares brought in, who came in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage:
verses.web: This was because of the false brothers secretly brought in, who stole in to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage,
verses.ct: The issue only came up because some fake believers had been sneaked in among us. They infiltrated our group to spy on the freedom we have in Christ Jesus, hoping to drag us back into slavery to the law.

verses.kjv: To whom we gave place by subjection, no, not for an hour; that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.
verses.web: to whom we gave no place in the way of subjection, not for an hour, that the truth of the Good News might continue with you.
verses.ct: We didn't give in to them for even an hour. We stood firm so that the truth of the gospel would be preserved for you.

verses.kjv: But of these who seemed to be somewhat, (whatsoever they were, it maketh no matter to me: God accepteth no man’s person:) for they who seemed to be somewhat in conference added nothing to me:
verses.web: But from those who were reputed to be important—whatever they were, it makes no difference to me; God doesn’t show partiality to man—they, I say, who were respected imparted nothing to me,
verses.ct: As for those who were considered important leaders — whatever status they held makes no difference to me, because God doesn't play favorites — those respected leaders added nothing to my message.

verses.kjv: But contrariwise, when they saw that the gospel of the uncircumcision was committed unto me, as the gospel of the circumcision was unto Peter;
verses.web: but to the contrary, when they saw that I had been entrusted with the Good News for the uncircumcised, even as Peter with the Good News for the circumcised—
verses.ct: Instead, they saw the opposite: that God had entrusted me with the gospel for the uncircumcised, just as he had entrusted Peter with the gospel for the circumcised.

verses.kjv: (For he that wrought effectually in Peter to the apostleship of the circumcision, the same was mighty in me toward the Gentiles:)
verses.web: for he who worked through Peter in the apostleship with the circumcised also worked through me with the Gentiles—
verses.ct: The same God who worked powerfully through Peter in his mission to the Jews was also working powerfully through me in my mission to the Gentiles.

verses.kjv: And when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that was given unto me, they gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship; that we should go unto the heathen, and they unto the circumcision.
verses.web: and when they perceived the grace that was given to me, James and Cephas and John, those who were reputed to be pillars, gave to Barnabas and me the right hand of fellowship, that we should go to the Gentiles, and they to the circumcision.
verses.ct: When James, Cephas, and John — the men recognized as pillars of the church — saw the grace God had given me, they shook hands with Barnabas and me as partners. We agreed that we would go to the Gentiles, and they would go to the Jews.

verses.kjv: Only they would that we should remember the poor; the same which I also was forward to do.
verses.web: They only asked us to remember the poor—which very thing I was also zealous to do.
verses.ct: Their only request was that we remember the poor, which was something I was already eager to do.

verses.kjv: But when Peter was come to Antioch, I withstood him to the face, because he was to be blamed.
verses.web: But when Peter came to Antioch, I resisted him to his face, because he stood condemned.
verses.ct: But when Peter came to Antioch, I confronted him to his face, because he was clearly in the wrong.

verses.kjv: For before that certain came from James, he did eat with the Gentiles: but when they were come, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing them which were of the circumcision.
verses.web: For before some people came from James, he ate with the Gentiles. But when they came, he drew back and separated himself, fearing those who were of the circumcision.
verses.ct: Before certain people arrived from James, Peter had been eating with Gentile believers. But when those people showed up, he pulled back and separated himself, because he was afraid of the circumcision group.

verses.kjv: And the other Jews dissembled likewise with him; insomuch that Barnabas also was carried away with their dissimulation.
verses.web: And the rest of the Jews joined him in his hypocrisy, so that even Barnabas was carried away with their hypocrisy.
verses.ct: The rest of the Jewish believers joined him in this hypocrisy, and it was so contagious that even Barnabas got swept up in it.

verses.kjv: But when I saw that they walked not uprightly according to the truth of the gospel, I said unto Peter before them all, If thou, being a Jew, livest after the manner of Gentiles, and not as do the Jews, why compellest thou the Gentiles to live as do the Jews?
verses.web: But when I saw that they didn’t walk uprightly according to the truth of the Good News, I said to Peter before them all, “If you, being a Jew, live as the Gentiles do, and not as the Jews do, why do you compel the Gentiles to live as the Jews do?
verses.ct: When I saw that they weren't acting in line with the truth of the gospel, I said to Peter in front of everyone, "You're a Jew, but you've been living like a Gentile, not like a Jew. So how can you now turn around and force Gentiles to follow Jewish customs?"

verses.kjv: We who are Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,
verses.web: “We, being Jews by nature, and not Gentile sinners,
verses.ct: "We are Jews by birth, not 'Gentile sinners.'

verses.kjv: Knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law, but by the faith of Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Jesus Christ, that we might be justified by the faith of Christ, and not by the works of the law: for by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified.
verses.web: yet knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law but through faith in Jesus Christ, even we believed in Christ Jesus, that we might be justified by faith in Christ, and not by the works of the law, because no flesh will be justified by the works of the law.
verses.ct: Yet we know that no one is made right with God by obeying the law, but only through faith in Jesus Christ. So even we have put our faith in Christ Jesus, so that we could be made right with God through faith in Christ — not by keeping the law. Because no human being will ever be made right with God by obeying the law.

verses.kjv: But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, is therefore Christ the minister of sin? God forbid.
verses.web: But if while we sought to be justified in Christ, we ourselves also were found sinners, is Christ a servant of sin? Certainly not!
verses.ct: But if, in seeking to be made right with God through Christ, we ourselves turn out to be sinners too, does that make Christ an agent of sin? Absolutely not!

verses.kjv: For if I build again the things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.
verses.web: For if I build up again those things which I destroyed, I prove myself a law-breaker.
verses.ct: If I rebuild the very system I tore down, then I prove that I was wrong to tear it down in the first place.

verses.kjv: For I through the law am dead to the law, that I might live unto God.
verses.web: For I, through the law, died to the law, that I might live to God.
verses.ct: Through the law, I died to the law so that I could live for God.

verses.kjv: I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself for me.
verses.web: I have been crucified with Christ, and it is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me. That life which I now live in the flesh, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself up for me.
verses.ct: I have been crucified with Christ, and I no longer live for myself — Christ lives in me. The life I now live in this body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.

verses.kjv: I do not frustrate the grace of God: for if righteousness come by the law, then Christ is dead in vain.
verses.web: I don’t reject the grace of God. For if righteousness is through the law, then Christ died for nothing!”
verses.ct: I refuse to treat God's grace as meaningless. Because if we could be made right with God by keeping the law, then Christ died for nothing."
